medical_history.chief_complaint: Loss of vision in the right eye.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient noticed decreased vision in her right eye one month prior to evaluation. Initially, there was no pain, photophobia, excessive lacrimation, or discharge. She and her mother decided to wait and see if the vision would improve spontaneously. After four weeks, a routine school eye examination led to a referral to an ophthalmologist, where leukokoria and a posterior fibrovascular lesion were noted, confirming the loss of vision.
medical_history.past_medical_history: No history of eye problems, and previous school eye examinations showed normal vision. Visual acuity was noted as 20/30 in both eyes at the age of seven.
medical_history.family_history: A younger brother had strabismus and amblyopia, being treated with glasses and a patch. Other family members were well, with no other family history of ophthalmologic problems.
